Key Match Events: The Oakland Athletics laid down three consecutive bunts to start the top of the 12th inning, scoring two runs to break a 2-2 tie in an eventual 4-3 win.
Hector Neris spiked the throw home into the infield grass, allowing Zack Gelof to score the go-ahead run.
Nick Allen's bunt allowed Daz Cameron to score, contributing to the Athletics' lead.
Jacob Wilson grounded into a double play to end the inning.
Jose Altuve hit an RBI double leading off the bottom half of the 12th inning.
Bryan Abreu struck out the side in the 11th inning for Houston.
Daz Cameron made a diving catch to rob Jeremy Peña of a hit and end the 10th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Houston manager Joe Espada expressed disappointment in his team's defense in the 12th inning.
Espada reflected on the game, stating, 'We battled to the end. We had the right guys at the plate when we wanted to and we just couldn’t — it was just one of those games.'
Daz Cameron commented on his diving catch, saying, 'The ball was tailing away and I dove at it and caught it. It was good knowing it kept us in the game to win it.'
